Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is speckled with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn in parts, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.200, pl.2)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36482) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36482)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 346 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
